@vishalsuvagia Since we do not currently have a way to get the secretkey from a jcek (which atlas uses to store the truststore password); do you want to include a tool to extract or should we point to cacerts for now?

@vishalsuvagia @oleewere  Change has been made. I used the following two libs that come with Ambari 

from resource_management.core.utils import PasswordString
from ambari_commons.credential_store_helper import get_password_from_credential_store

I also paved the way to autocreating the creds store for Atlas later on. I will do that as a separate PR

I agree with you; however, I think this part of a much bigger change. I believe we should have a standardized truststore across the cluster (maybe use the Ambari one) I do not know. I am speaking with Hortonworks' Product Team about this. 

When I do SSL, I use this https://github.com/amerissa/ambari-ssl-wizard/. It gives me the standardized truststore that be used by all services

@amerissa I'm pretty sure that on the roadmap (not really a standardized truststore, but a simple way to handle them, something like that), just im not sure who is working on that. (yeah, maybe product owners would know that better)

I think tests failing on purpose of changes done: 
```
1690502 [ERROR]   AlertMaintenanceModeListenerTest.testComponentMaintenanceMode:166 
  Unexpected method call AlertHistoryEntity.getAlertDefinition():
    AlertHistoryEntity.getComponentName(): expected: at least 1, actual: 1
    AlertHistoryEntity.getAlertState(): expected: at least 1, actual: 0
1690502 [ERROR]   AlertMaintenanceModeListenerTest.testHostMaintenanceMode:109 
  Unexpected method call AlertHistoryEntity.getAlertDefinition():
    AlertHistoryEntity.getComponentName(): expected: at least 1, actual: 1
    AlertHistoryEntity.getAlertState(): expected: at least 1, actual: 0
1690502 [ERROR]   AlertMaintenanceModeListenerTest.testServiceMaintenanceMode:137 
  Unexpected method call AlertHistoryEntity.getAlertDefinition():
    AlertHistoryEntity.getComponentName(): expected: at least 1, actual: 1
    AlertHistoryEntity.getAlertState(): expected: at least 1, actual: 0
```

hi @AliceXiaoLu ,
thank you for the contribution:
I have few points here:
- you do not need to include the patch file as well 
- AMBARI-22894 is already fixed on trunk, so that changes probably not needed (probably you should rebase your branch) 
- windows support is not required

```bash

```
